item.title: Leah add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "There ain't no such thing as a free lunch." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Leah add a quote by Malcom X
item.description: "You show me a capitalist, and I'll show you a bloodsucker" -- Malcom X

item.title: Leah add a quote by Allen Ginsberg
item.description: "Democracy! Bah! When I hear that I reach for my feather boa!" -- Allen Ginsberg

item.title: Leah add a quote by Edward Abbey
item.description: "Our 'neoconservatives' are neither new nor conservative, but old as Babylon and evil as Hell." -- Edward Abbey

item.title: Leah add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "Have you ever wondered why Republicans are so interested in encouraging people to volunteer in their communities? Itâ€™s because volunteers work for no pay. Republicans have been trying to get people to work for no pay for a long time. " -- George Carlin

item.title: Leah add a quote by Barbara Ehrenreich
item.description: "I was raised the old-fashioned way, with a stern set of moral principles: Never lie, cheat, steal or knowingly spread a venereal disease. Never speed up to hit a pedestrian or, or course, stop to kick a pedestrian who has already been hit. From which it followed, of course, that one would never ever -- on pain of deletion from dozens of Christmas card lists across the country -- vote Republican. " -- Barbara Ehrenreich

item.title: Leah add a quote by Barbara Ehrenreich
item.description: "What you don't necessarily realize when you start selling your time by the hour is that what you're really selling is your life." -- Barbara Ehrenreich

item.title: Leah add a quote by Barbara Ehrenreich
item.description:
"A lot of what we experience as strength comes from knowing what to do with weakness.
Nickel and Dimed On (Not) Getting By in America" -- Barbara Ehrenreich

item.title: Leah add a quote by Barbara Ehrenreich
item.description: "The urge to transform one's appearance, to dance outdoors, to mock the powerful and embrace perfect strangers is not easy to suppress." --Barbara Ehrenreich, Dancing in the Streets, 260." -- Barbara Ehrenreich

item.title: Leah add a quote by Hib Chickena
item.description: "This is what it means to be an adventurer in our day: to give up creature comforts of the mind, to realize the possibilities of imagination. Because everything around us says no you cannot do this, you cannot live without that, nothing is useful unless it's in service to money, to gain, to stability. The adventurer gives in to tides of chaos, trusts the world to support her - and in doing so turns her back on the fear and obedience she has been taught. She rejects the indoctrination of impossibility." -- Hib Chickena

item.title: Leah add a quote by stuart christie
item.description: "Anarchists have a 'bad name' in the media, not because they can point to one indiscriminate massacre by anarchists--there have been none--but because the one thing holders of power fear is that they personally should be held responsible for their own actions" -- stuart christie

item.title: Leah add a quote by Peter Marshall
item.description: "The aim is not therefore to liberate some 'essential self' by throwing off the burden of government and the State, but to develop the self in creative and voluntary relations with others." -- Peter Marshall

item.title: Leah add a quote by Robert Farrar Capon
item.description: "I like a cook who smiles out loud when he tastes his own work. Let God worry about your modesty; I want to see your enthusiasm." -- Robert Farrar Capon

item.title: Leah add a quote by Dalai Lama XIV
item.description: "This is my simple religion. There is no need for temples; no need for complicated philosophy. Our own brain, our own heart is our temple; the philosophy is kindness." -- Dalai Lama XIV

item.title: Leah add a quote by Emma Goldman
item.description: "The philosophy of Atheism represents a concept of life without any metaphysical Beyond or Divine Regulator. It is the concept of an actual, real world with its liberating, expanding and beautifying possibilities, as against an unreal world, which, with its spirits, oracles, and mean contentment has kept humanity in helpless degradation." -- Emma Goldman

item.title: Leah add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Leah add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "The Catholic novelist in the South will see many distorted images of Christ, but he will certainly feel that a distorted image of Christ is better than no image at all. I think he will feel a good deal more kinship with backwoods prophets and shouting fundamentalists than he will with those politer elements for whom the supernatural is an embarrassment and for whom religion has become a department of sociology or culture or personality development." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Leah add a quote by Thomas Carlyle
item.description: "If Jesus Christ were to come today, people would not even crucify him. They would ask him to dinner, and hear what he had to say, and make fun of it." -- Thomas Carlyle

item.title: Leah add a quote by Jeanette Winterson
item.description: "I seem to have run in a great circle, and met myself again on the starting line." -- Jeanette Winterson

item.title: Leah add a quote by Democritus
item.description: "Nothing exists except atoms and empty space; everything else is opinion." -- Democritus

item.title: Leah add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "Faith is a fine invention When gentlemen can see, But microscopes are prudent In an emergency." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Leah add a quote by Bob Pierce
item.description: "Let my heart be broken by the things that break the heart of God." -- Bob Pierce

item.title: Leah add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "I wonder that religion can live or die on the strength of a faint, stirring breeze. The scent trail shifts, causing the predator to miss the pounce. One god draws in the breath of life and rises; another god expires." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Leah add a quote by Dorothy Allison
item.description: "Fiction is a piece of truth that turns lies to meaning." -- Dorothy Allison

item.title: Leah add a quote by Dorothy Allison
item.description: "Two or three things I know for sure, and one of them is that if we are not beautiful to each other, we cannot know beauty in any form." -- Dorothy Allison

item.title: Leah add a quote by Dorothy Allison
item.description:
"I need you to do more than survive. As writers, as revolutionaries, tell the truth, your truth in your own way. Do not buy into their system of censorship, imagining that if you drop this character or hide that emotion, you can slide through their blockades. Do not eat your heart out in the hope of pleasing them.
" -- Dorothy Allison

item.title: Leah add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The merest accident of microgeography had meant that the first man to hear the voice of Om, and who gave Om his view of humans, was a shepherd and not a goatherd. They have quite different ways of looking at the world, and the whole of history might have been different. For sheep are stupid, and have to be driven. But goats are intelligent, and need to be led." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Leah add a quote by Gustavo GutiÃ©rrez
item.description: "We take it for granted that Jesus was not interested in political life: his mission was purely religious. Indeed we have witnessed . . . the 'iconization' of the life of Jesus: 'This is a Jesus of hieratic, stereotyped gestures, all representing theological themes. In this way, the life of Jesus is no longer a human life, submerged in history, but a theological life -- an icon." -- Gustavo GutiÃ©rrez
